item.title: #92Noon! Falness in for PA! Micheletti/Evason/Sorenson/Russo/Grimm/Talbot
item.description: --Kevin Falness is in for PA, and as you’d expect it’s a Hockey heavy show. Pat Micheletti is in studio for the first hour talking all things Wild and Gophers Hockey, Wild Head Coach Dean Evason joins ahead of training camp opening up, Gophers Forward Jonny Sorenson joins to talk his season thus far, Michael Russo talks Wild and his excitement to cover hockey again, Mike Grimm breaks up the Hockey show to talk Gophers hoops, and new Wild Goalie Cam Talbot joins to talk about his first few days in the State of Hockey.

item.title: #92Noon! PA is Back! Thad Levine/Bruce Boudreau/Pete Bercich/Courtney Cronin
item.description: PA is back in studio. Twins General Manager, Thad Levine, calls in to discuss the Twins spring training. Former Wild head coach Bruce Boudreau joins PA in studio to talk about his departure from the Wild for a long conversation covering everything from his departure from the Wild to his thoughts on the upcoming season. Pete Bercich joins the show to discuss what the NFL season might look like. And finally, ESPN journalist, Courtney Cronin breaks down the social justice work the Vikings have been a part of.

item.title: Darby Hendrickson with PA #92Noon!
item.description: KFAN plays Wild Classic Games on Wednesday nights at 7pm. This week it was a 12/17/2000 game between the Wild & Dallas Stars, the first time the new MN team met the old MN team. The Wild won 6-0, and Darby Hendrickson scored twice in the victory...he joined PA to reminisce and chat hockey!

item.title: #92Noon! Vox Quarantined in the Box
item.description: PA & Nordo are all by themselves in the box today, in the wake of the cancellation of morning skate, and quite possibly the game tonight against the Vegas Golden Knights due to increasing fears of Corona Virus. A surprise drop in from goalie, Alex Stalock, on what's been going on down in the locker room. Michael Russo joins over the Opal to discuss the possible cancellation of the NHL season. FSN's Ryan Carter and the Vikings Adam Thielen join as well.

And the elite football mind of Mike Florio to finish things off.

item.title: #92Noon Live From TCO: Lacroix/Larrivee/Kendricks/Odenigbo/Cousins/Brandt/Miller/Birk
item.description: Steve Lacroix, Executive Vice President & Chief Marketing Officer, talks IHeartMedia & KFAN's newly announced 5 year extension with the Vikings. The play-by-play voice of the Packers, Wayne Larrivee, joins the show to talk this week's upcoming border battle. Gil Brandt, former Vice President of Player Personnel for the Dallas Cowboys, talks the NFL 100 list. Chief Operating Officer for the Vikings, Andrew Miller, gives some insight into the front office side of things. As always, Matt Birke makes his weekly Wednesday appearance. Not to mention, Vikings linebacker Eric Kendricks, Vikings defensive end Ifeadi Odenigbo, & Vikings quarterback Kirk Cousins all stop by the TCO studio for some football conversation.

item.title: #92Noon with Eric Nordquist
item.description: The FAN's Eric Nordquist is in for PA today and has quite the cast of guests. First, we discuss Nordo's NFL scouting Sunday at Diamond Jo's. Resident Packer Expert, Dave Sinykin, calls in to talk the loss of his beloved team. Fox 9's, Ron Johnson, talks his own experience with the Badgers. And how he was made for GameDay. Hockey legend, Pat Micheletti, isn't mincing words about the season the Wild are having. Voice of the Gophers, Mike Grimm, looks back on the season so far and what this Saturday means for the Golden Gophers. And Head Coach himself, PJ Fleck, calls in to talk GameDay and the anniversary of getting the axe back.

item.title: #92Noon Live from TCO: Byron Chamberlain / Ryan Harris / Rich Gannon / Britton Colquitt
item.description:
The FAN's Paul Allen and Eric Nordquist are live from the TCO Performance Center in Eagan four days out from the home game against the Denver Broncos!
They speak with former Vikings tight end Byron Chamberlain, SB50 participant and former Bronco Ryan Harris, former Vikings QB Rich Gannon, and then close it out with current Vikings punter Britton Colquitt.

item.title: #92Noon Live from The Fair! Great NFC North Debate / Wobby / Russo
item.description:
The FAN's Paul Allen and Eric Nordquist are live from Carousel Park near the Grandstand for this first Monday of the Minnesota State Fair!
They welcome Vikings.com's Mike Wobschall to the program to talk Luck and other league-wide storylines, then... it's the 2019 Great NFC North Debate!
Finally, the show wraps up with the Athletic's Michael Russo who talks about the Wild's old and new GMs.

item.title: #92Noon! Sickman, Guys in The Cornfield, Jonny Athletic, Feast
item.description: Friday Football Feast. The Wild's Media Relations Director Aaron Sickman calls in to talk the upcoming season and Wild On The Water fishing tournament. The guys in the cornfield stop by to talk horse racing, the US Open and being a Dad. A 90 second phone call with Mike Zimmer on his race horse, Gina Baby. The controversy and tragedy at Santa Anita Track is an isolated incident and not the norm. And fellow basketball snob, Jonny Athletic, talks the NBA and getting to watch the final game with Gersson Rosas.

And Marnie Gellnar joins the last segment.

item.title: #92Noon Live from TCO! Wobby/Russo/Wiggins/Lombardi/Zimmer & Belichick Pressers
item.description: 92Noon is back at the TCO Performance Center as the Vikings prepare to battle the Patriots in Foxboro! Wobby stops by to preview the matchup, The Athletic's Michael Russo talks about a disappointing Minnesota Wild loss in an emergecy Russo Radio, Mike Zimmer holds his weekly presser, Nordo and PA go through some of Patriots Head Coach Bill Belichick's press conference call, the Birk Bit makes his regular appearance, former Viking and Patriot Jermaine Wiggins gives some insight on the Patriots, and Matt Lombardi calls in to talk all things football!

item.title: #92Noon Caplan/Leber/Andre Patterson/Jake Wieneke
item.description: It's PA's last show at this season's training camp. Adam Caplan gives his hot take on who will win the Super Bowl and who's going to be a star this season, regardless. Former MN Viking and current analyst, Ben Leber, weighs in. Defensive Line Coach, Andre Patterson joins the last hour to pay tribute to the late, Aretha Franklin. Kirk Cousins speaks from podium. MN native and Vikings rookie, Jake Wieneke, stops by for the last segment.

item.title: #92Noon at #KFANCombine: Florio/Zimmer/Schefter/Shurmur/Wobby
item.description: PA, Charch and Nordo are in Indianapolis for the 2018 NFL Combine! PFT's Mike Florio kicks off the show before Vikings Head Coach Mike Zimmer joins the broadcast. NFL Insider Adam Shefter stops by. New Giants Head Coach Pat Shurmur talks to PA about the transition to his new gig from his old gig as Vikings offensive coordinator. And Wobby closes the show talking all things purple, including the Vikings QB situation.

item.title: #92Noon Vox In The Box! Boudreau/Myers/Russo/Fletcher/Leopold
item.description: Vox In The Box is back! Wild.com's Dan Myers (1-0) co-hosts for the first hour, which features Wild Head Coach Bruce Boudreau. Michael Russo from The Athletic talks trade deadline and more. Wild GM Chuck Fletcher shares his thoughts on Monday morning's happenings and Jordan Leopold closes out the program talking about how difficult it can be, logistically, to be traded.

item.title: #92Noon Radio Row Day 5! Charch/Florio//Mariota/Flutie/Esiason/Harrison/Staubach/Keenum/Robinson
item.description: It's the final day on Super Bowl 52's Radio Row as PA, Nordo, and Charch are joined by an all-star list of guests! Mike Florio kicks off the show for the final time, Marcus Mariota talks SPAM, Doug Flutie stops by, Boomer Esiason talks about his preparations for calling the game on Sunday, Rodney Harrison talks about the winning the big game twice, Cowboys QB Roger Staubach shares the history of the Hail Mary, Case Keenum's wife Kimberly shares her Minneapolis Miracle story, Michael Robinson from NFL Network swings by and Wobby closes out a fantastic week of shows!
